newsitem.title: USA: Siemens unit gets $35 mln handsets contract.
newsitem.headline: Siemens unit gets $35 mln handsets contract.

text.p: Siemens Wireless Terminals said Tuesday it has won a contract worth more than $35 million to supply Western Wireless Corp with handsets used in advanced mobile communications.
Under the contract, Siemens will supply Western Wireless initially with its G1050 handset and accesory products.
In the future, the Siemens unit will provide the company with its G1250 handset models and other new products.

Western Wireless, an Issaquah, Wash.,-based wireless communications services company, will offer the handsets beginning in June in major metropolitan areas where its VoiceStream Wireless service is available.
Siemens Wireless is a division of Siemens Business Communications Systems, part of Siemens AG, whose GSM (global systems for mobile communications) handsets are sold in more than 70 countries.
